intro: Psychotria submontana, commonly known as the mountain psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in mountainous areas. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Psychotria submontana is also known for its association with certain species of epiphytic plants and its role in local ecosystems.
